page.title: 11Retew Valley Railway Line
page.content: This dismantled line has access at the southern end from the road by{Melbur {Mill}and at the north where it crosses the Treviscoe to Indian Queens road at {Trerice Bridge.}Although most of the stetch makes interesting walking along the banks of the{Fal River,}the land is owned by English China Clays and permission needs to be obtained. The line was built in 1874 to serve the clay industry as part of the{Cornwall {Mineral Railway.}From Melbur it connected at{St.Dennis Junction} (formerly called Bodmin Road Junction) with the Newquay to Par branch. The loading sheds and sidings at Mellangoose and the platforms at Melbur can still be seen.Modern methods of pumping clay by pipe to Par caused the demise of the line and the last train ran in 1983.
